properties.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 11 at 1:58PM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM CONTINUES TO BRING WIDESPREAD SNOWFALL ACROSS
MOUNTAINS AND LOWLANDS...

Falling afternoon temperatures has allowed for rain to change to
snow over portions of Luna, Sierra, and Dona Ana Counties in
southern New Mexico. Continued precipitation will result in
accumulations worthy of an advisory in those areas. 1-3" of
snowfall is possible along I-25 and I-10 east of Deming. Additional
snowfall over the mountains is expected this evening, with 4-8"
of new snow possible. Snow will begin to taper off early Wednesday
morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to
12 inches, with locally higher amounts possible.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, primarily the
Sacramento Mountains and Lincoln National Forest.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through late early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute as
roads may become impassable.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and drive to
accommodate the current conditions.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
